summary: This document is an email chain between legal parties regarding the scheduling of Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal trial. It includes a forwarded scheduling order from the court, confirming jury selection for the week of November 15, 2021, and the trial start date of November 29, 2021. The emails show coordination between the prosecution and defense to avoid scheduling conflicts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the trial is being scheduled.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, copied on the email correspondence regarding the trial scheduling.

connections.description: Henderson, as an AUSA, is part of the prosecution team for the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection Scheduled
events.description: The court's scheduling order sets jury selection to occur during the week of November 15, 2021.

events.title: Trial Start Date Scheduled
events.description: The court's scheduling order sets the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell to begin on November 29, 2021.

keyFacts: The court issued a scheduling order for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal trial (Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
Jury selection was scheduled for the week of November 15, 2021.
The trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.
The email correspondence shows coordination between the prosecution and defense to avoid scheduling conflicts for the proposed trial dates.
